intro: Gentiana macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows up to 60 cm tall, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are tubular with five lobes and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Gentiana macrocalyx thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows and woodland areas.
